docker-datasource-registry-image.description:
-> **Note:** The initial (current) version of this data source can reliably read only **public** images **from the official Docker Hub Registry**. Reads the image metadata from a Docker Registry. Used in conjunction with the
[docker\_image](/docs/providers/docker/r/image.html) resource to keep an image up
to date on the latest available version of the tag.

docker-resource-container.body:
resource "docker_container" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) (Required, string) The name of the Docker container.
    name = ""

    # image - (Optional) (Required, string) The ID of the image to back this container. The easiest way to get this value is to use the `docker_image` resource as is shown in the example above.
    image = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # entrypoint - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use as the
    entrypoint = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # user - (Optional) (Optional, string) User used for run the first process. Format is
    user = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # dns - (Optional) (Optional, set of strings) Set of DNS servers.
    dns = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # dns_opts - (Optional) (Optional, set of strings) Set of DNS options used by the DNS provider(s), see `resolv.conf` documentation for valid list of options.
    dns_opts = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # dns_search - (Optional) (Optional, set of strings) Set of DNS search domains that are used when bare unqualified hostnames are used inside of the container.
    dns_search = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # env - (Optional) (Optional, set of strings) Environment variables to set.
    env = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # labels - (Optional) (Optional, map of strings) Key/value pairs to set as labels on the
    labels = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # links - (Optional) (Optional, set of strings) Set of links for link based
    links = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # hostname - (Optional) (Optional, string) Hostname of the container.
    hostname = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # domainname - (Optional) (Optional, string) Domain name of the container.
    domainname = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # restart - (Optional) (Optional, string) The restart policy for the container. Must be
    restart = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # max_retry_count - (Optional) (Optional, int) The maximum amount of times to an attempt
    max_retry_count = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # must_run - (Optional) (Optional, bool) If true, then the Docker container will be
    must_run = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # capabilities - (Optional) (Optional, block) See [Capabilities](#capabilities) below for details.
    capabilities = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # ports - (Optional) (Optional, block) See [Ports](#ports) below for details.
    ports = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # host - (Optional) (Optional, block) See [Extra Hosts](#extra_hosts) below for
    host = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # privileged - (Optional) (Optional, bool) Run container in privileged mode.
    privileged = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # publish_all_ports - (Optional) (Optional, bool) Publish all ports of the container.
    publish_all_ports = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # volumes - (Optional) (Optional, block) See [Volumes](#volumes) below for details.
    volumes = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # memory - (Optional) (Optional, int) The memory limit for the container in MBs.
    memory = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # memory_swap - (Optional) (Optional, int) The total memory limit (memory + swap) for the
    memory_swap = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # cpu_shares - (Optional) (Optional, int) CPU shares (relative weight) for the container.
    cpu_shares = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # log_driver - (Optional) (Optional, string) The logging driver to use for the container.
    log_driver = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # log_opts - (Optional) (Optional, map of strings) Key/value pairs to use as options for
    log_opts = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # network_alias - (Optional) (Optional, set of strings) Network aliases of the container for user-defined networks only.
    network_alias = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # network_mode - (Optional) (Optional, string) Network mode of the container.
    network_mode = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # networks - (Optional) (Optional, set of strings) Id of the networks in which the
    networks = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # destroy_grace_seconds - (Optional) (Optional, int) If defined will attempt to stop the container before destroying. Container will be destroyed after `n` seconds or on successful stop.
    destroy_grace_seconds = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # upload - (Optional) (Optional, block) See [File Upload](#upload) below for details.
    upload = ""

    # command - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run `/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf` set the   command to be `["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]`.
    command = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "ip_address" - The IP address of the container as read from its
    # "command" - (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run "/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf" set the   command to be "["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]".
    # "ip_prefix_length" - The IP prefix length of the container as read from its
    # "command" - (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run "/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf" set the   command to be "["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]".
    # "gateway" - The network gateway of the container as read from its
    # "command" - (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run "/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf" set the   command to be "["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]".
    # "bridge" - The network bridge of the container as read from its
    # "command" - (Optional, list of strings) The command to use to start the   container. For example, to run "/usr/bin/myprogram -f baz.conf" set the   command to be "["/usr/bin/myprogram", "-f", "baz.conf"]".
}
docker-resource-container.description: Manages the lifecycle of a Docker container.

docker-resource-image.body:
resource "docker_image" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) (Required, string) The name of the Docker image, including any tags.
    name = ""

    # keep_locally - (Optional) (Optional, boolean) If true, then the Docker image won't be
    keep_locally = ""

    # pull_triggers - (Optional) (Optional, list of strings) List of values which cause an
    pull_triggers = ""

    # pull_trigger - (Optional) **Deprecated**, use `pull_triggers` instead.
    pull_trigger = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "latest" (string) - The ID of the image.
}
docker-resource-image.description:
-> **Note:** The initial (current) version of this resource can only pull **public** images **from the official Docker Hub Registry**. Pulls a Docker image to a given Docker host from a Docker Registry. This resource will *not* pull new layers of the image automatically unless used in
conjunction with [`docker_registry_image`](/docs/providers/docker/d/registry_image.html)
data source to update the `pull_triggers` field.

docker-resource-network.body:
resource "docker_network" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) (Required, string) The name of the Docker network.
    name = ""

    # check_duplicate - (Optional) (Optional, boolean) Requests daemon to check for networks
    check_duplicate = ""

    # driver - (Optional) (Optional, string) Name of the network driver to use. Defaults to
    driver = ""

    # bridge - (Optional) `bridge` driver.
    bridge = ""

    # options - (Optional) (Optional, map of strings) Network specific options to be used by
    options = ""

    # internal - (Optional) (Optional, boolean) Restrict external access to the network.
    internal = ""

    # ipam_driver - (Optional) (Optional, string) Driver used by the custom IP scheme of the
    ipam_driver = ""

    # ipam_config - (Optional) (Optional, block) See [IPAM config](#ipam_config) below for
    ipam_config = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" (string)
    # "scope" (string)
}
docker-resource-network.description:
Manages a Docker Network. This can be used alongside
[docker\_container](/docs/providers/docker/r/container.html)
to create virtual networks within the docker environment.

docker-resource-volume.body:
resource "docker_volume" "$1" {
    # name - (Optional) (Optional, string) The name of the Docker volume (generated if not
    name = ""

    # driver - (Optional) (Optional, string) Driver type for the volume (defaults to local).
    driver = ""

    # driver_opts - (Optional) (Optional, map of strings) Options specific to the driver.
    driver_opts = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "mountpoint" (string) - The mountpoint of the volume.
}
docker-resource-volume.description:
Creates and destroys a volume in Docker. This can be used alongside
[docker\_container](/docs/providers/docker/r/container.html)
to prepare volumes that can be shared across containers.
